GIS.geometry

Class GISPolyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.geometry.Geometry
      • GIS.geometry.GISPolyline
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GISPolygon

    public class GISPolyline
extends Geometry
    Polyline Class, inherits from Geometry. Points can be added to the empty line with the Method "addPoint()", that will add a Point Object to the Point ArrayList. To write Feature in DB or CSV the coordinates can be transformed to the right format using "writeAsText()". To read it from a DB or CSV use "textToPoint()" To get a drawable geometry for Graphics2D use "getGeometry()"
    Author:
    Lukas

      java.util.ArrayList<GISPoint> pointlist

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint(GISPoint point)
      Adds a point object to the attribute pointlist return true when processed sucessfull
      void calculateLength()
      calculate the length of a Polyline, stored in Attribute length (not realized yet, could be done using the Path2D object)
      java.awt.geom.Path2D getGeometry() 
      java.lang.String getGeometryAsText()
      write the points of a line so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded.
      float getLength()
      returns the value of attribute length of a Polyline.
      boolean setGeometryFromText(java.lang.String geometry)
      when receiving a feature geometry from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" textToPoint("1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765") will split the string at the "," to receive the different points. " " spereates their x and y coordinates.
      void setTypeToPolygon()
      The class GISPolygon inherits from GISPolyline and must be able to change the type of the Geometry class to "Polygon".

    • Constructor Detail

      • GISPolyline

        public GISPolyline()
        Creates an empty Polyline Object. Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Detail

      • setTypeToPolygon

        public void setTypeToPolygon()
        The class GISPolygon inherits from GISPolyline and must be able to change the type of the Geometry class to "Polygon". This method provides that functionality.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(GISPoint point)
        Adds a point object to the attribute pointlist return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        point - an instance of the class GISPoint

      • getGeometryAsText

        public java.lang.String getGeometryAsText()
        write the points of a line so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded. should be something like that: x1 = 1.234 y1 = 5.678 x2 = 4.321 y2 = 8.765 getGeometryAsText() "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" - 2 seperators: "," for different points " " for the two coordinates of a point
        Returns:
        String with the Geometry as readable Text

      • setGeometryFromText

        public boolean setGeometryFromText(java.lang.String geometry)
        when receiving a feature geometry from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" textToPoint("1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765") will split the string at the "," to receive the different points. " " spereates their x and y coordinates. For each coordinate pair a Point object will be generated and stored in the ArrayList "pointlist". return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        geometry - a String received from writeGeometryAsText()
        Returns:
        true when method was sucessfull, false for errors

      • getGeometry

        public java.awt.geom.Path2D getGeometry()

      • calculateLength

        public void calculateLength()
        calculate the length of a Polyline, stored in Attribute length (not realized yet, could be done using the Path2D object)

      • getLength

        public float getLength()
        returns the value of attribute length of a Polyline. (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use calculateLength) (not realized yet, could be done using the Path2D object)
        Returns:
        length (float)
